<<<<<<< HEAD
By the King, a proclamation for the apprehending of robbers or highway-men, and for a reward to the apprehenders England and Wales. Sovereign (1660-1685 : Charles II) Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.
1 broadside.
Printed by John Bill, Christopher Barker, Thomas Newcomb, and Henry Hills ..., London : 1677.
"Given at our court at Whitehall the 20th day of June 1677, in the nine and twentieth year of our reign." Reproduction of the original in the Huntington Library.
=======

Printed by John Bill, Christopher Barker, Thomas Newcomb, and Henry Hills ..., London : 1677.
"Given at our court at Whitehall the 20th day of June 1677, in the nine and twentieth year of our reign." Reproduction of the original in the Huntington Library.
